text:
That's an interesting journey! Do you spend much time working in Houdini, or is it mostly Nuke that you work in?

And that's great! This term we have an industry set brief - so that's what I've been working on recently. I'm doing an effects brief for DNEG, and the task is to create two unique magical effects on a rune stone. My first concept is a glowing vein effect, and my second is an electric/Tesla coil effect. I've done some test renders, so it would be great to get some feedback on how they can be improved! I forgot to hide some particles on the electricity effect though, so please ignore the bubble wrap look on the crystal :sweat_smile:

Here's the link to the renders:
<https://drive.google.com/file/d/1ipoALE2CaemD0lMpjduZVY6spdKrJieX/view?usp=drivesdk|https://drive.google.com/file/d/1ipoALE2CaemD0lMpjduZVY6spdKrJieX/view?usp=drivesdk> 

Thanks! :blush:

I'm mostly in nuke but I try to fight to do some houdini stuff all the time. Lately, in His Dark Materials, I managed to work on the windows between universes and the Daemon death effects mixing Houdini and Nuke; quite fun stuff.
Unique, special, magical  are the only keywords?
Is it a brief as part of your job application?
